revised_title: Leonard Erskine Hill: A Pioneering Physiologist and Medical Researcher
tldr: Leonard Erskine Hill was a prominent British physiologist and medical researcher who made significant contributions to the understanding of cerebral circulation, blood pressure, and decompression sickness. His work on intracranial pressure, the armlet method for measuring arterial blood pressure, and the effects of exposure to high atmospheric pressures greatly advanced the field of physiology and medicine.
